text:
Looking for resources on the #coronavirus? 

Head over to https://t.co/at7IF8uR8n for info on what you can do to help flatten the curve, what resources are available to you if you have a small business, and what action Congress has been taking.
Important info for Delaware seniors ⬇️ https://t.co/lAPyFXpnvI

Additional questions may be directed to the Delaware Department of Justice’s Consumer Protection hotline at 1-800-220-5424. Learn more about how to protect yourself from scammers by going to https://t.co/Fy8c0Ss5ni.
You can also report scams, such as robo-calls, to the Federal Trade Commission at https://t.co/dFsvvkGZLc. Learn more about phone scams at https://t.co/octcBVH740.

Please report any cases of price gouging, scams, or fraud to Delaware’s Consumer Protection Unit by filing a consumer complaint form at https://t.co/kmJdEieTlD and emailing supporting documentation to consumer.protection@delaware.gov.

*Attention Delaware*
 
Unfortunately, scammers are taking advantage of the anxiety consumers are feeling during the #COVID19 pandemic. During a State of Emergency in Delaware, price gouging is illegal.

Attention to Delaware small businesses, eligible nonprofits, Vets organizations, and Tribal businesses – the Department of Treasury has released its guidance on the Paycheck Protection Program authorized through the CARES Act. It can be found here.

Just visit https://t.co/knXZwE7293 to fill yours out now. And while you’re at it, encourage your family and friends to fill theirs out too. #DelawareCounts

On this #TDoV, I am celebrating this community. I’m reminded of why we need to be fighting for the equal rights that the community deserves. 

Especially in such uncertain times, I want to let every trans and non-binary person know: we see you and love you! - LBR (she/her) https://t.co/crvkVdGkRg

Today is #EqualPayDay. Today marks how long a woman would have to work into this year to earn what a man did in 2019. As so many Americans are struggling, it is more important than ever to value the work of women as much as men’s and for their paychecks to reflect that. https://t.co/bgTY6x3Sgr

Health care workers are risking their lives to care for #COVID19 patients. Giving them hazard pay for the courage they are showing is the least we can do to show our gratitude. https://t.co/aq2zEM4131.
As my friend @SenatorCarper said, this is a completely irresponsible time to finalize this rule.

This rollback is counterproductive and harmful. It makes our air dirtier, puts the health of our families at risk, and makes our auto manufacturers less competitive. 
https://t.co/Q1Qt1kUect

Tag me, @RepLBR, and use the hashtag #DEHealthHero when you post your video or respond and let us know who your #DEHealthHero is!

And to all the health heroes out there, we appreciate you. Thank you so much for everything you do.

Health care professionals have been on the front lines fighting the #coronavirus for us. Now it's time for us to show them our love and appreciation.

Record a short video to say Thank You to a #DEHealthHero https://t.co/HQaIX7hFLK

We couldn’t possibly say it enough times or in enough different ways.
 
Thank you, thank you, thank you.
#NationalDoctorsDay

Getting ready to vote on our 3rd #coronavirus relief package.

We've heard from lots of constituents with lots of different questions about the virus itself, the Congressional response, and what they can do to help flatten the curve and stop the spread. That's why, today, I'm sharing with you our new coronavirus resources page on our website
As we're getting ready to vote to pass the third #coronavirus relief package here in Congress, I wanted to share with you something my team and I have been working on recently.

Very sad to hear the news that a Delawarean has died from #COVID19. I'm praying for his family and friends. I'm also thinking of all those on the front lines providing heroic care during this incredibly challenging time. https://t.co/ZO0TGqwVSw

This is not the end of our work, and we must continue to address the needs of the American people as this crisis unfolds, but for now - it’s time to pass the bill.

The bill is not perfect - no bill this size is perfect - but we cannot let perfect be the enemy of progress during a national crisis. American families, workers, and small businesses are hurting and this is no time for delay.

It’s time to pass the bill. Members of the Senate and the administration have been negotiating in good faith for a number of days to form a legislative package that can pass the Congress. 
https://t.co/CGvZ8W2iwg

RT @RepBarragan: Proud to join @RepLBR in support of health care workers serving on the frontlines of the #Coronavirus pandemic.
 
Those ri…
These health care workers put their own personal well-being on the line every day that they go into work. The least we can do ensure that they have what they need during this crisis.
I’m going to continue to fight for emergency bonus payments, increased access to mental health services, and rapidly expanding the health care workforce.

As we continue to negotiate a legislative response to the #COVID19 outbreak, it crucial that we keep our frontline health care workers at the forefront of everything we do. That’s why, today, I led a letter to House Leadership asking them to do just that. https://t.co/k4amvTk19l

As we fight the #coronavirus pandemic, we’re reminded of just how important access to affordable coverage is. That’s why I’m working every day in Congress to expand access and lower the cost of health care.

10 years ago, today, the Affordable Care Act was signed into law. Protecting and building upon the legacy of the ACA was one of the main reasons I came to Congress in the first place. https://t.co/QBLAoBl3W7

It has been a full year since @HouseDemocrats passed #HR1, the #ForThePeople Act, and it has *still* seen no action in the Senate thanks to @senatemajldr. When it comes to fighting corruption and keeping our elections fair, this bill would be transformative.

When the American people are back in charge of our political system, we could:
⤴️: Raise wages and create jobs 
⤵️: Lower the cost of prescription drugs
❌: Fight the epidemic of gun violence

The thousands of Americans who become victims of gun violence every year deserve action. I urge Leader McConnell to bring #HR8 to the floor immediately. The House passed this bipartisan bill to expand background checks nearly a year ago & it’s time for the Senate to do the same.

It was an honor of my life to preside over the House of Representatives during today's historic vote on the Equal Rights Amendment. 

This vote was about a simple proposition - that all individuals, no matter their sex, are equal under the law.  #ERANow https://t.co/LZ1w3A4KdK

"Equality of rights under the law shall not be denied or abridged by the United States or by any State on account of sex."

On this vote, the Yeas are 232, the Nays are 183. The Joint Resolution is passed! 

#ERANow https://t.co/X1odFE0mWB

Today's the day. I'm so immensely proud to be heading to the floor of the House of Representatives to preside over our historic vote on the Equal Rights Amendment. 

Equality has NO deadline. 

#ERANow https://t.co/q9m2KyJlOV
